title: Pending status Awaiting Discharge
question: i had rule 2004 mean test and after that i havent received anything from the trustee and now when i check pacer for pending status on my bankruptcy, the status is awaiting discharge. What does that mean and how long will it take to receive the discharge
answers: This process will continue until the UST decides to fight or abandon the issue. The longest challenge I had was 2.5 years in the making.

Typically, the form B9 you received from the bankruptcy court will tell you when you are eligible to receive your discharge. Look under the section marked "Deadlines."

In my community, my clients typically receive their discharge a few days after the final deadline noted has expired.

Hope this perspective helps.

There's nowhere near enough information to answer your question. First of all, Rule 2004 is a procedure to take an examination (deposition). The means test is a form that gets filled out. I'm not sure what a "rule 2004 mean test" is. In a chapter 7 case where no assets are being disbursed by the Trustee, the discharge is usually granted after 60 have passed since the first date set for your meeting with the Trustee in your case, unless that time period is extended by the court. This also assumes the Trustee has concluded his meeting and filed a "no asset" report.

In order to answer your question I need to know if any of the above has happened, and if so, what the relevant dates are.

Mark J. Markus, Attorney at Law
Handling exclusively bankruptcy law cases in California since 1991.
http://www.bklaw.com/
